content.description: Sit start with both hands on the obvious big hold towards the bottom and legs going to the left of the starting hold. This problem requires you to throw to a hold that is kind of loose but it seems secure enough, Pad placement is easy and the top off and walk off is not sketchy. Also, this very well may not be the first accent but the info on the other boulders in the area don't match this one and it looked untouched when we came.
content.protection: One crash pad should do the trick
content.location: Coords are roughly: 41.033311, -112.264261. It's a slanted face. Within the boulder field at the end of the trail.

content.description: Follow the clear line of hand jams up to the top. Crux seems to be the top out. Make sure to have a good spotter/belayer because the landing is quite uneven and rocky. It's a fairly good place to practice protection placements without having to worry much about a big fall.
content.protection: Small pro, crashpad, or just solo it
content.location: Go north on the Buffalo Point trail until you get to a large boulder field where the trail sort of dissolves. The rock is to the east of where the trail dissolves. It's further to the east than the Arrowhead route. Scramble off the west side to east side to get down.

content.description: Easy face climb on the south side of the boulder formation. No significant crux
content.location: Follow the Buffalo Point trail north until you reach a large boulder field where the trail sort of dissolves. Go about halfway down the boulder field and to the east to find the arrowhead shaped boulder.

content.description: OW boulder that starts as a nice fist crack that widens to an OW section at the top. Crux seems to be the top out.
content.location: Take the Buffalo Point trail north for about a quarter mile. You'll come to a very open saddle on the trail and the boulder is to the west of the north end of the saddle.

content.description: Move up the obvious arete, switching from face climbing to stemming between two boulders. Crux is about halfway up where hand holds become scarce.
content.location: Same description as Antelope Off-Width. Take the Buffalo Point trail and go north until you get to a cleared out saddle. Go to the north end of the saddle and then turn off to bushwack to the west to two large boulders down the hill. Antelope Arete is to the east of Antelope Off-Width.
